quiz.question: A student questions reality, claiming nothing is real. Plato’s response?
options: A) Reality is what we see
C) Ideas are the only real things
quiz.platoQuote: "The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself."

quiz.question: A student questions reality, claiming nothing is real. Plato’s response?
options: A) Reality is what we see
C) Ideas are the only real things
quiz.platoQuote: "The measure of a man is what he does with power."

quiz.question: A ruler must choose between appeasing the majority or following philosophical truth. What should guide him?
quiz.platoQuote: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something."

quiz.question: A ruler must choose between appeasing the majority or following philosophical truth. What should guide him?
quiz.platoQuote: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something."

quiz.question: A ruler must choose between appeasing the majority or following philosophical truth. What should guide him?
quiz.platoQuote: "The beginning is the most important part of the work."

options: A) Reality is what we see
C) Ideas are the only real things
quiz.platoQuote: "Ignorance, the root and stem of all evil."
